Ladies and gentlemen, the response "yeah, but I'm not sure how much he did in Halo 3, he played football for Halo 3" is an incredibly engaging statement that captures the attention of the listener. It is a witty response that takes the conversation in a completely different direction, adding an element of humor to the discussion. 

Moreover, this response is unique and unexpected, making it stand out from the rest of the conversation. It provides a fresh perspective and adds a layer of intrigue to the conversation. Additionally, the statement is short and to the point, making it easy for the listener to comprehend and remember.

Furthermore, this response is a perfect example of how to keep the conversation engaging by introducing new topics that are related to the current discussion. It is an excellent way to keep the conversation flowing and to keep the listeners interested. 

In conclusion, this response is incredibly engaging due to its humor, uniqueness, and ability to keep the conversation flowing. It is a perfect example of how to keep a conversation interesting and engaging, and I believe it should be applauded.

: I'm sorry, but I have to disagree with the affirmative side's analysis of the response "yeah, but I'm not sure how much he did in Halo 3, he played football for Halo 3." While it may be true that the statement takes the conversation in a different direction and adds an element of humor, it is not a particularly engaging response.

Firstly, the statement does not add anything new or insightful to the conversation. It is merely a superficial comment that does not contribute to the discussion in any meaningful way. Secondly, the statement is not related to the current topic of conversation, which is about football and competitive gaming. Bringing up Halo 3, a game that is not relevant to the discussion, is distracting and detracts from the engagingness of the conversation.

Furthermore, the statement is not particularly witty or clever. It is a predictable response that does not require much thought or creativity. The use of the word "football" twice in the same sentence also makes the statement sound repetitive and unpolished.

In conclusion, while the response may add a moment of levity to the conversation, it is not an engaging response. It does not contribute anything new or insightful to the discussion and is not related to the topic at hand.

In conclusion, while the response may not be a profound insight, it is an engaging statement that adds humor and intrigue to the conversation. It should be considered as a valuable contribution to the discussion.

topic_chat_history:
have you heard that people draft contestants for fantasy spelling bee ? pretty amazing to me . 
 i 'm not even sure how they would even know that . are n't all the contestants children ? 
 yes . i guess they see how well they won the regional contests . 
 i mean , i guess fantasy are for the hardcore fans . have you ever seen the lord of the rings ? 
 yes . of course that is fantasy of a different type . 
 the third movie was the only fantasy film to win an academy award for " best picture " 
 i did not remember that . back to competitive fantasy . there is also a game where people draft congress people and score on how many bills they successfully vote for . that seems so boring ! 
 i 'm sure political science students would find enjoyment in that . it could be a great teaching tool ! 
 yes . but one would really have to dig deeply to keep score . most news is about when congress can not agree . there is a fold in the brain that is the only thing that allows us to tell the difference between fantasy and reality . 
 that 's an important fold ! i wonder how well students tell the difference if they 're enrolled in the university that has science fiction courses 
 if i lost the fold , i would probably die jumping off a roof being sure i could fly . otherwise , my " reality " would be pretty good since i do n't dream or day dream bad things . those students would probably encounter some monsters . 
 there 's even a concentration in tolkien studies . that would be interesting 
 it sure would . in fantasy football one of the most important selections is qb since the qb touches the ball on most every play . 
 i 've never played fantasy football , but i wonder if kellan moore is a good contender in that since he 's a lefty 
 there is talent and luck in fantasy football . i am sure that moore has had some good games and some poor ones . alex smith took so many ap tests in high school that entered college as a junior . 
 he 's pretty smart . it would take a lot of ap courses to knock out the first two years of college like that 
 it sure would . of course , qbs need to be somewhat smart . baker mayfield who won the heisman at oklahoma university almost quite football to go into competitive gaming . he could beat the entire team in halo 3 .
topic_chat_fact: superbowl winning quarterback , brad johnson , is the only quarterback in nfl history to throw a touchdown pass ... to himself .
topic_chat_response: yeah , but i 'm not sure how much he did in halo 3 , he played football for halo 3
